alert.note: Alert for Butler (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 02 at 5:56PM EDT until July 02 at 6:30PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 PM EDT FOR PREBLE AND NORTHWESTERN BUTLER COUNTIES... At 556 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Lewisburg to Seven Mile, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and power lines. Locations impacted include... Hamilton, Oxford, Trenton, Eaton, Camden, West Alexandria, Gratis, Seven Mile, West College Corner, Williamsdale, Darrtown, College Corner, Somerville, West Elkton, Jacksonburg, Oklahoma, West Florence, Collinsville, Morning Sun and Wheatville. This includes I-70 in Ohio between mile markers 1 and 4. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. To report severe weather, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
